alert.note: Alert for Gwinnett (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 29 at 10:53PM EDT until August 30 at 9:21AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Crooked Creek near Norcross affecting Gwinnett and Fulton Counties. Nancy Creek at Johnson Ferry Road at Chamblee affecting DeKalb and Fulton Counties. Suwanee Creek at Suwanee affecting Gwinnett County. For the Suwanee Creek...including Suwanee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Suwanee Creek at Suwanee. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9 feet, Minor flooding expands along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at U S Highway 23 or Buford Highway. Most of the Suwanee Creek Greenway and trails are flooded from the Suwanee Creek Park to George Pierce Park. The minor flooding will also begin to affect portions of the playground area behind the Suwanee Elementary School. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 9.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 0.5 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 930 AM EDT.
